title: The Zero Product Property
text: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
speech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
pacedSpeech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.

title: Factoring the Equation
text: To factor this equation, we must expand and re-factor. $$\left(x+6\right) \left(x-3\right)=x^2+3x-18$$. So, we have $$x^2+3x-10$$. Factoring this, we get $$\left(x+5\right) \left(x-2\right)=0$$
speech: To factor this equation, we must expand and re-factor.  parentheses x plus 6,  times, parentheses x minus 3,  is equal to x squared plus 3 x minus 18 . So, we have  x squared, plus 3 x minus 10 . Factoring this, we get  parentheses x plus 5,  times, parentheses x minus 2,  is equal to 0
pacedSpeech: To factor this equation, we must expand and re-factor.    x plus 6,  times,  x minus 3,  is equal to x squared plus 3 x minus 18
. So, we have   x squared, plus 3 x minus 10
. Factoring this, we get    x plus 5,  times,  x minus 2,  is equal to 0

title: Using the Zero Product Property
text: As per the zero product property, if $$\left(x+5\right) \left(x-2\right)=0$$, then either $$x+5$$ or $$x-2$$ is equal to $$0$$. Setting both of these to $$0$$, $$x=-5$$ and $$x=2$$. Summing these values, we get $$-3$$
speech: As per the zero product property, if  parentheses x plus 5,  times, parentheses x minus 2,  is equal to 0 , then either  x, plus 5  or  x, minus, 2  is equal to  0 . Setting both of these to  0 ,  x is equal to, negative 5  and  x, is equal to, 2 . Summing these values, we get  negative 3

. Summing these values, we get   negative 3
